talk.author: did:plc:jsowo4x4dytbl5hpjbm4e3tt
talk.utter:
My friend felt symptoms on the 21st and tested positive on the 22nd. By the 26th he was testing negative (twice) and feeling fine.

Which is just to say that it’s variable, and right now the only tool we have are rapid tests and you should at least wait until you’re testing negative.

talk.author: did:plc:62gdkmpwa7xme36getyqnem3
talk.utter: It definitely varies a lot but your friend’s 4 days is the shortest I’ve heard of personally by about half

talk.author: did:plc:jsowo4x4dytbl5hpjbm4e3tt
talk.utter:
I was surprised too. Of course, given what I recently read about the ubiquitous BTNX tests here in Canada, I’m not sure it means non-contagious.

I wish we could get updated rapid tests that aligned with current contagious periods.

talk.author: did:plc:jsowo4x4dytbl5hpjbm4e3tt
talk.utter:
I was surprised too. Of course, given what I recently read about the ubiquitous BTNX tests here in Canada, I’m not sure it means non-contagious.

I wish we could get updated rapid tests that aligned with current contagious periods.

talk.author: did:plc:62gdkmpwa7xme36getyqnem3
talk.utter: The rapid tests don’t need to be updated for new strains; they work the same on all of them. If they are faulty tests it’s not because they need an update

talk.author: did:plc:jsowo4x4dytbl5hpjbm4e3tt
talk.utter: I was under impression the contagious period had moved somewhat in a typical infection (partly due to so many people having had previous exposure either through infection or vaccine), and wasn’t sure if rapid tests were really as useful as they previously were.
